turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Brown-tailed mongoose.
turn.1: What's the deal with the brown-tailed mongoose?
turn.2: Brown-tailed mongoose The brown-tailed mongoose, Malagasy brown-tailed mongoose, or salano ("Salanoia concolor") is a species of mammal in the family Eupleridae.
turn.6: Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical dry forests.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: It is threatened by habitat loss.
turn.10: The brown-tailed mongoose was first described in 1837 by French zoologist Isidore Geoffroy Saint-Hilaire under the names "Galidia unicolor" and "Galidia olivacea".
turn.11: Is it similar to any other animals?
turn.12: He placed both in the genus "Galidia", together with the ring-tailed mongoose ("Galidia elegans"), which is now recognized as the only species of that genus.
